title: Pictures reveal the bloody world of dog fighting in Kyrgyztan
text:
Vicious dog fighting in the Kyrgyztan capital Bishkek is a regular event (Picture: AFP/Getty)

Shocking pictures show ferocious dogs baring razor sharp teeth amid flashes of blood soaked fur during traditional dog fights in Kyrgyztan.

The celebrated event in the country’s capital city of Bishkek sees collosal Central Asian Shepherds battling it out to be crowned ‘champion’ of the breed.

Dog fighting is against the law in countries across the world but is a national tradition in Kyrgyzstan and many other central Asian countries, including neighbouring Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan.

Spectators, including many young children, turn out to watch the national breed practically ripping each other apart in the bloodthirsty event.

Pictures taken at an arena in Bishkek on Sunday show owners refereeing the bloody fights.

Shocking pictures show some of the dogs covered in blood (Picture: EPA)

Dog fighting remains a national tradition in Kyrgyzstan (Picture: EPA)

Those watching filmed the barbaric bouts on their smartphones.

The huge dogs, some who had started out with light coloured fur, were soon a shade of maroon.

Central Asian Shepherds, known locally as Alabai, weigh up to 220lbs and are pitted against each other in order to improve the breed going forward, owners claim.

Breeders say they must prove the dogs’ worth to potential buyers who risk having their livestock decimated by wolves and foxes if they pick the wrong animal.

The dogs do not fight to the death but are hauled off each other once the dominant dog has been identified, the owners said.

Spectators, including children, watched and filmed the fights on smartphones (Picture: EPA)

The fights are organized by a local dog breeders club with the aim of finding the dog best suited to improve the Asian Shepherd breed, organizers said (Picture: EPA)

Some 23 owners brought their dogs to fight for the title of ‘champion of breed’ (Picture: EPA)
